description: Plan: `python3 scripts/validate_plan.py ee/docs/plans/2026-01-31-edit-other-users-time-entries` passes.
DB: Migration adds `time_entries.created_by` and `time_entries.updated_by` columns.
DB: FK constraints for `created_by`/`updated_by` exist and are tenant-scoped.
Types: `ITimeEntry` includes optional `created_by`/`updated_by` and build/typecheck passes.
Validation: `timeEntrySchema` accepts entries with/without `created_by`/`updated_by`.
Auth: Self access is allowed (actor can access their own time periods/time sheets/entries).
Auth: Billing/system admin (with `timesheet:read_all` + `timesheet:approve`) can access any user tenant-wide.
Auth: Manager-of-subject (team manager) can access subject users in their managed teams.
Auth: Manager cannot access users outside managed teams.
Auth: User without delegation permissions cannot access another user’s time sheets/entries (403/permission error).
Actions: Eligible-subjects action returns self-only for non-delegates.
Actions: Eligible-subjects action returns team members for managers (only teams they manage).
Actions: Eligible-subjects action returns all internal users for tenant-wide admins.
Actions: `fetchTimePeriods(subjectUserId)` rejects unauthorized subject user.
Actions: `fetchOrCreateTimeSheet(subjectUserId, periodId)` rejects unauthorized subject user.
Actions: `fetchTimeSheet(timeSheetId)` rejects unauthorized non-owner.
Actions: `fetchTimeEntriesForTimeSheet(timeSheetId)` rejects unauthorized non-owner.
Actions: `fetchWorkItemsForTimeSheet(timeSheetId)` rejects unauthorized non-owner.
Actions: Creating a time entry on behalf sets `time_entries.user_id = subjectUserId` (not actor).
Actions: Updating a time entry does not change `user_id` ownership.
Actions: On create, `created_by` and `updated_by` are set to actor; on update, `updated_by` changes to actor.
Actions: `work_date` is computed using the subject timezone (edge case around midnight local time).
Actions: Time entry timestamps outside the time period boundary are rejected.
Billing integrity: Editing an invoiced time entry is blocked.
Billing integrity: Deleting an invoiced time entry is blocked.
Billing integrity: Reopening a time sheet with any invoiced entry is blocked.
Approvals: Delegate can submit a subject’s time sheet and time entries transition to `SUBMITTED`.
Approvals: Billing/system admin can approve a subject’s time sheet tenant-wide.
Approvals: Manager can approve only subject time sheets for users in managed teams.
Approvals: Reopen operation transitions time sheet and entries to `CHANGES_REQUESTED` and becomes editable in the UI.
UI: User selector is hidden/disabled for non-delegates and defaults to self.
UI: Eligible-subjects list populates UserPicker correctly (team-scoped vs tenant-wide).
UI: Selecting a subject changes the displayed time periods and opens subject’s timesheet.
UI: Timesheet header shows subject identity and indicates delegated editing when applicable.
UI: “Reopen for edits” appears only for authorized users on APPROVED, non-invoiced time sheets and executes successfully.
Security regression: Manager-scoped operations cannot be widened by passing arbitrary team ids from the client.
